window

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • window.Window

  • public class Window
extends java.lang.Object
    Object oriented wrapper class above the native GLFW window.
    See Also:
    GLFW

    • Nested Class Summary

      Mouse shape.

        Sets the cursor shape to the specified image.
        Parameters:

        click - the cursor hotspot is specified in pixels, relative to the upper-left corner of the cursor image

      • getFrameSize

        @NotNull
public static org.joml.Vector4i getFrameSize()
        Returns the size of the window's frame. First value is the left, second is the top, third is the right and the fourth is the bottom.
        Returns:
        size of the window's frame

      • setClientAreaSize

        public static void setClientAreaSize(@NotNull
                                     org.joml.Vector2i size)
        Sets the size of the window's client area to the given value.
        Parameters:
        size - client area's size
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - width and height must be positive

      • setClientAreaSizeLimits

        public static void setClientAreaSizeLimits(int minWidth,
                                           int minHeight,
                                           int maxWidth,
                                           int maxHeight)
        Sets the size limits of the window's client area to the given values.
        Parameters:
        minWidth - minimum width
        minHeight - minimum height
        maxWidth - maximum width
        maxHeight - maximum height
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the minWidth and minHeight can't be lower than 0, the maxWidth can't be lower than minWidth and the maxHeight can't be lower than the minHeight

      • disableClientAreaSizeConstraint

        public static void disableClientAreaSizeConstraint()
        Disables the client area size constraint set by calling setClientAreaSizeLimits method. By calling setClientAreaSizeLimits method again, the constraint will be enabled again.

      • getAspectRatio

        public static float getAspectRatio()
        Return the aspect ratio of the window's client area.
        Returns:
        aspect ratio

      • setAspectRatio

        public static void setAspectRatio(int numerator,
                                  int denominator)
        Sets the required aspect ratio of the client area of the window. If the window is full screen, the aspect ratio only takes effect once it is made windowed. If the window is not resizable, this function does nothing. The aspect ratio is specified as a numerator and a denominator and both values must be greater than zero. For example, the common 16:9 aspect ratio is specified as 16 and 9, respectively. The aspect ratio is applied immediately to a windowed mode window and may cause it to be resized.
        Parameters:
        denominator - denominator
        numerator - numerator
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - width and heigh must be positive
        See Also:
        disableAspectRatioConstraint()

      • disableAspectRatioConstraint

        public static void disableAspectRatioConstraint()
        Disables the aspect ratio constraint set by calling setAspectRatio method. By calling setAspectRatio method again, the constraint will be enabled again.

      • getPosition

        @NotNull
public static org.joml.Vector2i getPosition()
        Returns the position, in screen coordinates, of the upper-left corner of the client area of the window.
        Returns:
        position

        public static void setPosition(org.joml.Vector2i position)

        Parameters:

      • getId

        public static long getId()
        Returns the glfw window's id. You should use it only if you really don't have other choise.
        Returns:
        window's id

      • swapBuffers

        public static void swapBuffers()
        Swaps the back and the front buffers. You should call it once every frame.

        Listens for events. You should call it once every frame.

      • isWindowShouldClose

        public static boolean isWindowShouldClose()
        Returns the value of the close flag of the window. If it returns true the window and the application will close unless a WindowEventHandler counteracts.
        Returns:
        the close flag's value

      • setWindowShouldClose

        public static void setWindowShouldClose(boolean close)
        Sets the window's close flag to the given value. If you set it to true the window and the application will close unless a WindowEventHandler counteracts.
        Parameters:
        close - window's close flag

      • isMinimized

        public static boolean isMinimized()
        Determines whether the window is minimized.
        Returns:
        true if the window is minimized, false otherwise

      • release

        public static void release()
        Releases the resources owned by the window. After calling this method, you can't use the window for anything. You should only call this method when the program terminates.
